results.title: Interleukin balance and early recovery from anesthesia in elderly surgical patients exposed to beta-adrenergic antagonism.
results.text_hl: The cytokine response of these elderly surgical @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ was similar to that of younger @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, and the perioperative profile of proinflammatory and antiinflammatory cytokines was not affected by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. CONCLUSIONS: Perioperative administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ to elderly surgical @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ markedly improves physical sense of well-being, which coincides with improved @<m>DISEASE_Pain_Postoperative</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010149 @@@postoperative pain@@@ control and decreased analgesic requirements.

citations.NLM: Shyong EQ, Lucchinetti E, Tagliente TM, Hossain S, Silverstein JH, Zaugg M. Interleukin balance and early recovery from anesthesia in elderly surgical patients exposed to beta-adrenergic antagonism. J Clin Anesth. 2003 May;15(3):170-8. PMID: 12770651
